actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
The House observed a moment of silence in remembrance of the three Burnsville, Minnesota first responders who died in the line of duty.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 1034 — "Electing Members to certain standing committees of the House of Representatives."
The House received a communication from the Honorable Dina Titus. Ms. Titus submitted her resignation from the Committee on Homeland Security. The resignation was accepted without objection.

Mr. Bean (FL) asked unanimous consent That, when the House adjourns on Friday, March 1, 2024, it adjourn to meet at noon for morning-hour debate and 2:00 p.m. for legislative business. Agreed to without objection.
Mr. Bean (FL) asked unanimous consent when the House adjourns Thursday, February 29, 2024, it adjourn to meet at 10 a.m. on Friday, March 1, 2024. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 7128 — "To establish requirements relating to size standard compliance of small business concerns owned and controlled by women for certain purposes, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 5426 — "To require the Administrator of the Small Business Administration to provide a link to resources for submitting reports on suspected fraud relating to certain COVID-19 loans."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 401
actions-list.actionItem: 19 (Roll no. 59).

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 7454 — "To amend title 49, United States Code, to extend authorizations for the airport improvement program, to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to extend the funding and expenditure authority of the Airport and Airway Trust Fund, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 320
actions-list.actionItem: 99 (Roll no. 58).
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 7463 — "Making further continuing appropriations for fiscal year 2024, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 402
actions-list.actionItem: 16 (Roll no. 57).
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 7102 — "To establish an Office of Native American Affairs within the Small Business Administration, and for other purposes."
The Chair announced that the unfinished business was the question on the motions to suspend the rules which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 7463.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Ms. Granger moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 7463 — "Making further continuing appropriations for fiscal year 2024, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 7454.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Graves (MO) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 7454 — "To amend title 49, United States Code, to extend authorizations for the airport improvement program, to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to extend the funding and expenditure authority of the Airport and Airway Trust Fund, and for other purposes."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House proceeded with one-minute speeches, which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mrs. Lesko to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of February 29.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 12:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Dale W. Strong to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
